rounds.response:
White has just placed the bishop on b5, pinning my knight on c6. This is a main line of the Four Knights / Italian System. Fighting the pin is critical—I’ll counter-pin with 5…♗f8b4, re-clamping White’s knight, creating immediate tactical threats against e4, and steering us into the (drenched-in-theory) “Ruy Lopez – Bb5 with …Bb4” complex. The upside: if White defends e4 inaccurately, I can nab it with …♘c6xe4 or …♘f6xe4; if he plays c3, my bishop can retreat to a5, keeping queenside castling options intact. And castling short is coming fast once the f8–b4 diagonal clears.

[f8b4]
